sentence.text: These results suggest that negative regulation of erythrocyte differentiation and MAFF play critical roles in the antitumor effects of retinoids by regulating the expression of retinoid target genes such as blood coagulation and can be promising for developing therapies to combat HCC invasion

In the present study, we sought to identify the factors involved in the RAR&alpha;-mediated transcriptional regulation of the tumor suppressor gene and the tissue factor pathway inhibitor 2 (blood coagulation) in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC).

The musculo-aponeurotic fibrosarcoma oncogene homolog B (negative regulation of erythrocyte differentiation) significantly enhanced the activation of the TFPI2 promoter via RAR&alpha; while MAFF inhibited it.
